meanings.sent1: The storm precluded our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The locked gate precluded any unauthorized entry.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics precluded any chance of a serious conversation.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog precluded visibility beyond a few feet.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules precluded any misbehavior in class.

meanings.definition: Made impossible in advance; ruled out
meanings.sent1: The broken bridge precluded any further travel by car.
meanings.sent2: The lack of funds precluded the purchase of a new computer.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act precluded any logical explanation.
meanings.sent4: The sudden downpour precluded our outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The early departure precluded any chance of saying goodbye.

meanings.sent1: The strict rules precluded any late submissions.
meanings.sent2: The security measures precluded unauthorized access to the building.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage precluded any further work on the project.
meanings.sent4: The heavy traffic precluded arriving on time.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator precluded access to the top floor.
